Haha, yay! I didn't think anyone would notice. T___T <3

Interesting fact, carrots don't really improve your eyesight.

It was a British World War II campaign to trick the Germans into thinking that vegetables were increasing their ability to spot enemy planes, rather then advance in RADAR.

I'm 100% serious: http://www.smithsonianmag.com/arts-culture/a-wwii-propaganda-campaign-popularized-the-myth-that-carrots-help-you-see-in-the-dark-28812484/?no-ist

Actually they do but in other words. If I remember correctly from biology class, the vitamin in carrots should help regenerate retina. So even though it's not like you improve eyesight by them and not like it's the only vegetable containing it, it helps maintin retina healthy.

And OP even said 'help' not 'improve'.
sounds like a cure for many people in league that need to improve their map awareness{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
HOLY SHIT! That is hilarious! TAKE THE UPVOTE!
+1 for fun facts

Insights designer...are you serious?

What the heck do you do? :D You help people perceive problems?

Because if so, that's awesome.
Haha, pretty much! I help our Insights team communicate interesting findings through storytelling. I'm pretty lucky. :)

Can just imagine a lead designer on some champion concept thinking "Hm..i think an ability to slap people with fishes is too humiliating. Should i scrap it?"

You:"Well if you look at the symbolic meaning behind slapping someone with a fish you may see that it could increase gameplay value on both the fun and the humiliation part. It could add variety to the game and mix up killing with flopping around."

Designer:"You're right. Release skin will be Fizz/Nami related. Maybe even Urf related. Thanks!"
